intro: Serratula subacaulis, commonly known as the slender sickleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in arid to semi-arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a serrated edge, giving it a distinctive appearance. Serratula subacaulis is a perennial herb that produces yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer to early autumn.
